result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason J. Schmidt

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:43 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason J. Schmidt appeared by video.  Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Jason J. Schmidt. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial. Inducement is for concurrent probation.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:42 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason J. Schmidt appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Jason J. Schmidt. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-06-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance is reset to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.

2:26 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason J. Schmidt in court. Attorney Luke Harrison in court for defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 03-29-22.
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess drug paraphernalia, possess methamphetamine, possess schedule I or II narcotic and felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-18-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
